quotes.quote: The pressures were wrong. There was just enough money and not enough time.
Pressure is a word that is misused in our vocabulary. When you start thinking of pressure, it's because you've started to think of failure.
No pressure, no diamonds.
Pressure is something you feel when you don't know what the hell you're doing.
Let pressure pass over and through you. That way you can't be harmed by it.
Pressure is a privilege it's what you do with it that matters.
Pressure is only what you make of it and what you put on yourself.
Don't ever let the pressure exceed the pleasure.
Pressure is a privilege - it only comes to those who earn it.
Pressure has the power to create a diamond, but it has to be the "right" pressure.
How we handle pressure will determine whether we stand or break.
When we long for life without difficulties, remind us that oaks grow strong in contrary winds and diamonds are made under pressure.
Pressure comes from a lack of preparation.
Higher learning undergoes emotional pressure.
The more pressure you place on yourself, in search of increase the more you will likely get of it
Pressure is nothing more than the shadow of great opportunity.
All pressure is self-inflicted. It's what you make of it or how you let it rub off on you.
Life's pressure is equal to your resistance.
External pressure seems to produce internal unity.
Only the unprepared are overcome by pressure.
Nothing counts but pressure, pressure, more pressure, and still more pressure through broad organized aggressive mass action.
Pressure comes from within and so must be mastered from within.
Pressure can either burst a pipe or make a diamond.
Pressure is playing for ten dollars when you don't have a dime in your pocket.
I'm sick of all the pressure. I'm sick of feeling like I'll ruin all their happiness if I don't do what they want me to do.
Remember diamonds are created under pressure so hold on, it be your time to shine soon.
Pressure is not necessarily bad. Pressure can make you produce. The challenge of pressure is learning how to handle it--which requires developing internal confidence and inner strength.
When the pressure comes, preferences give way while convictions hold firm.
Pressure doesn't exist. We create it for ourselves.
Pressure squeezes effort out of winners and excuses out of losers.
